column4: hi, I'm trying to change tho boot-sequence for my ancient toshiba laptop, but I'm not getting into the bios, anyone know how I could? (it's definatly not del)
f1 or f12?
not F1
not F12 either :/
weird, does it not tell you on the initial screen?
no, it just says Toshiba and does a ram-check
and it tries to read tho floppy-drive first, but nothing happens (I have a bootfloppy already in it)
have fun... I gotta run though...
thats weird, have you looked on toshiba's website?
not yet, but I'm afraid there is no support for this machine yet :P)
have you tried esc?
YES \o/, esc and then F1 :P
so it worked?
except I can't set the boot-sequence, what is weird, when it boot's it first tries the floppy, but it doesn't get it or something :/
toshiba's are weird: Ill see what I can see
ah, I know recognise the bootsequence in the bios (weird stuff) and it's FDD->HDD, so that's right
hmmm... you dont have a cd??

actually I'm trying an install of debian sarge :$ like this http://www.linux-on-laptops.com/hosted/t4900b.html  only with these images: http://ftp.debian.org/debian/dists/sarge/main/installer-i386/current/images/floppy/
no cdrom no :P
I need to do a network install, I'd like to try ubuntu otherwise, is there a minimal network install for ubuntu available?
Im not sure mate... got to run...--->
